tasks.task: Planting and caring for caladium plants.
subtasks: Prepare planting location with well-drained, rich soil.
Plant tubers or bulbs two inches deep, ensuring proper orientation.
Water consistently in warm weather, adjusting depth based on frost risk and precipitation.
Start plants indoors four to eight weeks before planting outdoors if desired.
Pair caladiums with complementary plants like impatiens or justicia in gardens or containers.
Apply slow-release fertilizer and ensure even moisture.
Monitor for pests like slugs and snails and apply appropriate treatments.
Prepare plants for winter by allowing foliage to die back naturally.
Lift and store tubers in cool, dry conditions to overwinter.
Resume care when temperatures warm, fertilize and water as needed.
